result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Alexander Moreno

records.addlTxt: Signed and filed: Scheduling Order for Jury Trial Dated February 6, 2023
Received and Filed: Proposed Scheduling Order for Jury Trial Dated February 6, 2023

Defendant Richard Alexander Moreno appeared by video.  Attorney Gregg H. Novack appeared by video for Richard Alexander Moreno.  Attorney James Griffin in court on behalf of Attorney Patrick J Anderson for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense has not received an offer but requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Pre-trial Scheduling Order signed and filed by the Court.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Richard Alexander Moreno appeared by video.  Attorney Gregg H. Novack appeared by video for Richard Alexander Moreno.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick J Anderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense is requesting a global offer. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Richard Alexander Moreno in court with Attorney Gregg H. Novack; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Taylor Schmitz - MPD Officer. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney Gregg Novack

No driving without a valid license.
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

ADDRESS INFO for Richard Alexander Moreno
Current: 8736 S County Dr #103, Milwaukee, WI 53215   (Effective: 08-08-2022)
Prior: 2129 South 13th Street, #102, Milwaukee, WI 53215

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Swanson, Branch 11.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

Defendant Richard Alexander Moreno in court with Attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
